page.title: 18Ecology-The Beach.
page.content: We made a class visit to the local beach and divided the beach into three main areas.Firstly, the upper section above the high tide line a middle section and a third lower section.At the top of the beach are quite high sandy cliffs which are full of fossils, it is quite easy to find a few sharks teeth and other fossils.Like most beaches in the south of England there is a lot of rubbish left by the tide.We found the usual collection of rubbish from passing ships plus plastic bottles,old shoes,tyres,fishing tackles bits etc.etc. The middle section contained a little seaweed,mostly bladderwrack,and evidence of cockles under the surface of the mud.There were a number of shells mostly cockles and scallop shells but also razor shells, winkles,mussels and oysters.
